comments:
From http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/vep-
home/WebContent/docs/testcases/smoketest1/smoketest1.htm

Basic Beans Inspection 
Open BasicSwingComponentsBundled.java 
and run via the JB Launcher.
This produces the following error...
IWAV0055I Java Bean BasicSwingComponentsBundled started with the main method
IWAV0053E Illegal Access Exception creating BasicSwingComponentsBundled
java.lang.IllegalAccessException: Class 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.vce.launcher.remotevm.JavaBeansLauncher can not 
access a member of class BasicSwingComponentsBundled with modifiers "public 
static"
	at sun.reflect.Reflection.ensureMemberAccess(Reflection.java:74)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:384)
	at 
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.vce.launcher.remotevm.JavaBeansLauncher.main
(JavaBeansLauncher.java:71)

BasicSwingComponentsBundled is not a public class. By definition, a "bean" 
should be public. I don't think this is a bug. And if you do define it as 
public, don't expect to see much because: a) the class itself isn't a visual 
bean and b) it doesn't define any public properties. It should look the same as 
BasicSwingComponents in the VE though.

FYI: the test script probably doesn't mention running this class in the launcher 
for this reason.
not a bug as per alasdair comment
Since this bug was not reOpened for more than a month, this bug is verified.

traces.message: Class  org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.vce.launcher.remotevm.JavaBeansLauncher can not  access a member of class BasicSwingComponentsBundled with modifiers "public  static"
